title: Change in kinetic energy due to potential diff

content.question: A charged sphere with an initial speed <math alttext="v sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> has a final speed <math alttext="2 v sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><msub><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> when accelerated through a potential difference <math alttext="delta V sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mrow><mi>V</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> . What potential difference is needed to accelerate the same charged sphere from an initial speed <math alttext="2 v sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><msub><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> to a final speed <math alttext="4 v sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>4</mn><msub><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
